questions.text: Who was the first king of Israel?
questions.explanation: Saul was anointed by Samuel as the first king of Israel.

questions.text: How many days did God take to create the world?
questions.explanation: God created the world in six days and rested on the seventh.

questions.text: Who built the ark?
questions.explanation: Noah built the ark according to God's instructions to save his family and animals from the flood.

questions.text: What was the name of Abraham's wife?
questions.explanation: Sarah was Abraham's wife and the mother of Isaac.

questions.text: How many plagues did God send upon Egypt?
questions.explanation: God sent ten plagues upon Egypt before Pharaoh let the Israelites go.

questions.text: Who was swallowed by a great fish?
questions.explanation: Jonah was swallowed by a great fish after trying to flee from God's command.

questions.text: Which apostle betrayed Jesus?
questions.explanation: Judas Iscariot betrayed Jesus for thirty pieces of silver.

questions.text: Where was Jesus born?
questions.explanation: Jesus was born in Bethlehem, the city of David.

questions.text: How many disciples did Jesus choose?
questions.explanation: Jesus chose twelve disciples to be his apostles.

questions.text: Who wrote the Book of Revelation?
questions.explanation: The apostle John wrote the Book of Revelation while on the island of Patmos.

questions.text: What is the first book of the Bible?
questions.explanation: Genesis is the first book of the Bible and tells of creation and early history.

questions.text: Which Gospel was written by a tax collector?
questions.explanation: Matthew, also called Levi, was a tax collector before following Jesus.

questions.text: In which Gospel do we find the parable of the Good Samaritan?
questions.explanation: The parable of the Good Samaritan is found only in Luke's Gospel.

questions.text: Which Gospel begins with 'In the beginning was the Word'?
questions.explanation: John's Gospel begins with a profound theological statement about Jesus as the Word.

questions.text: Who was the strongest man in the Bible?
questions.explanation: Samson was given supernatural strength by God, which was connected to his uncut hair.

questions.text: Who was thrown into a den of lions?
questions.explanation: Daniel was thrown into the lions' den for praying to God, but was protected by an angel.

questions.text: Who was the mother of Samuel?
questions.explanation: Hannah prayed earnestly for a child and promised to dedicate him to the Lord.

questions.text: Which book contains 'The Lord is my shepherd'?
questions.explanation: Psalm 23, written by David, begins with 'The Lord is my shepherd.'

questions.text: Who wrote most of the Proverbs?
questions.explanation: King Solomon, known for his wisdom, wrote most of the Book of Proverbs.

questions.text: Which prophet was taken up to heaven in a whirlwind?
questions.explanation: Elijah was taken up to heaven in a whirlwind with chariots of fire.
